data.title: Government Colleges in Laheriasarai, Bihar
data.text:
The term Laheriasarai, might be new to most of us, but it is a popular name among the people of Bihar since it is a city located in the Northern Bihar and is considered as twin city of the District of Darbhanga. The city has a long cultural heritage and it has been an integral part of the city of Mithila and has a religious importance for Hindus particularly Brahmins with Jha Surnames. Many of the important offices belonging to the district of Dharbanga are located in Laheriasarai.

Name of the city:

The name of the city was derived from the caste called Lahiri engaged in making of Lahathi (Lac Bangle). However, the professional based on caste has completely vanished these days and the city is the administrative area of Dharbanga. The city was the home for the popular literary figure Acharya Ramlochan Saran, whose grandsons are still living in the city.

Higher education in Laheriasarai:

As far as higher education in the city is concerned, it is the home for only a single government run college being a professional medical college and the name and some of the details regarding this college are given below:

â€¢ Dharbanga Medical College, Laheriasarai

Dharbanga Medical College, Laheriasarai:

Dharbanga Medical College is functioning under the control of the government of Bihar and the college is approved by the Medical Council of India and is affiliated to L.N. Mithila University. The college was incepted in the year 1946 and the Medical Council of India has approved the college to admit 90 students per year for the MBBS course. The college has produced many health care professionals to the nation and the alumnus of this college are performing as successful doctors serving from different parts of the nation and abroad as well.
